Reviews.Title: “DO NOT, DO NOT, DO NOT GET A ROOM HERE!”
Reviews.Author: amojoudy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are were just staying one night in New aorleans before our cruise left the next day, so we thought we would get a basic hotel room and booked at St. Vincent Guest House on Magazine st. In NOLA . . . . It said a "non-smoking room, king size bed, ac, and free breakfast" we aren't snobs or rich by any means so we booked it. When we got there Hurricane Isaac had just blown through so there was no power hence no AC, that wouldn't have been an issue if you could open a window . . . But you can't. It also has what seems like permanent guests there so you don't feel comfortable leaving your things in your room or opening the door to let fresh air in. Also the bed was a FULL at best . . . . No where near a King, super low to the ground and I would not put my skin on those stained sheets even if I weren't 5months pregnant! The room was relatively clean and so was the bathroom, but there is a nice low window that comes down to about your waist while you sit on the toilet and look out onto . . . . The walkway . . . They have a no refund policy . . . For good reason, we checked in to our room, walked down to Canal st., booked a different room and checked out within 2 hours and they took our $60 dollars. The house is really an historical landmark and shouldn't be used as an hotel or hostel. They had a certificate at the front desk that said they had passed a bedbugs inspection, but like I said, we didn't stay to find out if it was true or not . . . THIS IS NOT THE PLACE FOR YOU IF YOU WANT TO ENJOY YOUR HOTEL STAY. Stay here if you want a youth hostel or a place to live for a while on the cheap. Also, the guy at the front desk was very polite so we did not have an issue with the staff, just the false advertising and crappy conditions .

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nathan B
Reviews.Content: Mel the girl at the front desk is psychotic and rude. The two girls at the front desk are very rude Brandi is the other girl I think but Mel was cold from the door and threw the entire stay. we saw her cleaning at one point and she was cursing the whole time. Everytime we spoke to her to say hi she always cut her eyes and gave us dirty loooks. its like a half way house a bunch of homeless people or squaters stay there for free . they trade housekeeping/maintaince (which is joke by the way) but they work in trade for the room. so i guess thats the last resort before they end up on the street. ITS DISGUSTING! dont bring your bathing suit! DO NOT LEAVE YOUR VALUABLES IN THE ROOM!!!! The place needs a new owner and REAL employess...it has hope and potential but the owner and staff have let it become a cold, nasty , flop house. Id rather sleep in my car! for real im not kidding! every bad review on this site is sooooooooo true! PLEASE BE ADVISED AND TAKE THESE WARNINGS SERIOUSLY!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and staff”
Reviews.Author: jocelyne ross s
Reviews.Content: The thing about a good hostel is the location, a comfortable bed, a decent shower and proximity to all necessities. The thing about the St. Vincent is it offers all of that. If you are looking for glamour youÂ´ve come to the wrong place. This is a place to rest your weary head in an airconditioned space. The area (Garden District) is one of the most quaint in New Orleans. I came from Montreal with a friend of mine and this place made our trip. The restaurant is awesome and accross the street is a pretty great cafe. Walking distance to all things good and cheap

Reviews.Title: “We had a great experience! Wonderful staff! Awesome property!”
Reviews.Author: BWM324
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at St. Vincent's Guest House for five days, starting on July 4, 2012. This is both of our first time to stay in a hostel. We did have a private room. Our room was large, with a huge bathroom. The TV, microwave and AC worked great. I knew we were not walking into a high end hotel. We chose to spend 5 days in New Orelans and experience the city vs 1 day in a nice hotel. Our experience at St Vincent's was great. The people there are wonderful and want to help, assist, and provide any info you ask for. The cafe is cute, lots of great food and drinks. We used the WiFi without any issues. I will agree the place could use a few million in repair, but then our budget would only have allowed us to stay there 1 day. The property is awesome. The location is wonderful. The employees make the place. I wish they gave tours of the building! SUMMARY If you want to experience New Orleans in a hostel / low priced room this is a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you have other options.”
Reviews.Author: NicMor6680
Reviews.Content: As they say, you get what you pay for. The pictures from the website are very misleading, because the bedroom I got did not look half as good as the ones on the website. The room was run down, burnt and torn curtains, comforter looked like it was at least 10 years old. The carpet was old, the waste basket sat in a hole in carpet. The ensuite bathroom, was not much better. The cleanliest thing in the whole room was the toilet. I had a nice surprise of roaches in the bathroom when I went to use it at night. I should have known when I say the can of Raid on top of the closet. Was supposed to stay there 2 nights, but after the first, I stayed out the whole next night to avoid sleeping there. The staff is friendly, but as far as my room, which was room 30, I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I had an open mind going in, and was so wrong”
Reviews.Author: kimrleon843
Reviews.Content: We had a rather large wedding in New Orleans planned and about 15 different family members needed a inexpensive place to stay for 7-10 days. I was a late show, so I didnt get to experience the "Holy Cow" moment when you walked in the door. I was forwarned. When I went to check in, I noticed the stairs that were cracked, the hand rail was litterally falling off its hinges, and the entire front lobby had a stale smell. I checked in and was shown to the second floor. I had the better room out of the 8 that were rented by us. I didn't have dirty carpets, I had an actual closet and my bathroom was relatively clean with no bugs. My family didn't get so lucky. They made an immediate stop to Walmart, to purchase, Raid, Extra Towels, Cleaning Supplies and bug traps. They put them all to use. I was terrified about sleeping by myself so I bunked with my two Aunts. Each night, I made them go into the room first, check for roachs and other various bugs. Can we say disgusted? There were quite a few homeless/crack head/ strange individuals staying at the orphanage. I never felt safe..at all. Delta Angel is there so called restaurant on site. Please explain how an near empty kitchen with a table cloth on a table is moving eratically entirely on its own. ROACHES...There is no grading system in New Orleans. The 6th day we were at the hotel an older family member of mine (75) noticed a leak in the ceiling. The leak turned into a down poor, which turned into the entire ceiling in room 4 to come crashing down, missing him by a foot. I'm not exagerating by saying, all 15 of us checked out in one swoop. I didn't request a refund, I didnt even care at that point. We all checked into the Hampton In at a cost of $109 per night for the remainder of our stay. The worst hotel, I have ever stayed in..If you can even call it that.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: victorialhw
Reviews.Content: Not the prettiest place but really fair price for a double room. The bed was good, there was enough room for our stuff and the bathroom was clean. The staff was friendly and the internet worked perfect. The kitchen was unfortunately closed at the time. Magazine Street has great food options and you can walk to the tram and take it easily to the city.

Reviews.Title: “This is an old hostel.. I love it!”
Reviews.Author: klinkker
Reviews.Content: I kn ow, I know.. it is grimy. Some hookers might stay there.. The pool is never clean. I'm too afraid to eat the food at the little restaurant inside but, I love this place. First off, it's a hostel, not a hotel. Second, there are not many hostels that offer you your own room with a TV and your own bathroom with towels. The history of it is cool and spooky. The people at the front desk are slow and honest. This place is just New Orleans in a nut shell for me. The bones of the hostel are beautiful (like a lot of New Orleans). It's close to a lot of stuff. It's right next to the bus stop to get to downtown and the French Quarter. If you don't like the bus, cabs are always around. We always stay here and we have never had roaches in the bed or bedbugs or anything. The staff is very polite. We did once have a roach in the bathroom but, if you know New Orleans, even the nicest places will get a roach. My hubby and I love coffe and there is a coffe house right across the street called, "Mojo". It's great! Voodoo themed and just wacky like a real coffee house should be. Love it.

Reviews.Title: “RIP OFF, DIRTY, SMELLY, HAUNTED!”
Reviews.Author: Jakemcgowan
Reviews.Content: Long story short: DO NOT STAY HERE! Water leaked through the ceiling and onto our bed. Manager is a witch. It's an old orphanage and were told by the maintenance man that this place is haunted! Bugs and cockroaches in the beds. $10 deposit for the keys (which they didn't return). The only good about this place was the location. Magazine St. Close to cool food places but it's still $10 in a taxi to bourbon st. AGAIN, PLEASE DO NOT STAY HERE. YOU WILL REGRET IT.

Reviews.Title: “the worst ever”
Reviews.Author: traveller60864
Reviews.Content: After travelling for 4 months through South America including guest houses in the poorest parts of Bolivia we found the worst accommodation of our lives at saint vin cents guest house A.K.A the new orleans drunk and mental institution. This stay will include a freak constantly drunk wheel chair bound neighbour that screams and moans all day and especially all night to the point that it sounds as if somebody is being murdered while throwing trash cans down the hall which apparently does not seem to be noticed by any other guest or employee. The staff have absolutely zero interest in helping in any way with your stay, your reservation will most likely have not even been received due to a complete breakdown in the hotels system. Rooms will include a busted t.v with no channels, a bed more than likely full of lice, carpets which could actually be confused as a patch of filthy 18th century moss, and a classic dungeon odour. Constant hot water was the one bonus to wash our lice bitten bodies at night. This place is as miserable as it gets so don't do it to yourself. Im getting itchy just writing about it. P.s no sheet changes, no room cleans, no fresh towels, and no toilet paper. Welcome to hell.

Reviews.Title: “Good place and worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Jack H
Reviews.Content: After reading quite many negative comments I was a bit worried about this place. But knowing people complain about almost everything nowadays I thought I'd give it a try. We spent there 3 nights in a room with 2 queen size beds and everything worked fine. Room could have been cleaner but for us it was no problem taking account the cheap price. Staff was OK. Not the best service in reception but I don't really care as long as I get the room I have booked and everything works alright. If I go back New Orleans I'm definately going to stay here again. The building was awesome and it had a great atmosphere! Guesthouse felt quite safe. I would recommend this place for people seeking for good atmosphere and who appreciate the beauty of old buildings. Free advise for people complaining about dirtyness. You don't get fancy rooms with cheap price. Don't expect 5 star quality and service with this price range in this distance from the centre. If you're looking for sterile rooms, go to places that are much more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Easter Stay 2012”
Reviews.Author: B B
Reviews.Content: Just spent my Easter in NOL and stayed at the St Vincents Guest house. We had not been there since prior to Katrina. I admit it is NOT the Ritz ,it is an old place with alot of charm and history that fits the area well. We had a small dog and were charged 30$ non refundable deposit for him. The staff was very nice and helpful. The room was not the best but it was fairly clean and comfortable enough. And they let us look at it boefore we paid. My gosh, WHAT do you expect for $50 a night with FREE fenced parking! I never felt unsafe or in danger at all. It is NOT a hotel, it is a guest house. No bugs, not alot of noise. Probably go back this summer with friends again....and yes...stay there.

Reviews.Title: “they won't refund our deposit, I think they rip people off on purpose”
Reviews.Author: trevor-wa
Reviews.Content: we booked a stay thru our travel agent with a 7 day cancel policy on our amex card. We cancelled 12 days prior but it's been 30 days now and even after several calls to them by our travel agent "we'll look into it" - no deposit refund. I just disputed the charge with amex but the initial response from amex was they couldn't help because the initial deposit charge was more than 60 days ago - we are very good amex customers and when a supervisor was contacted they agreed to dispute the charge. Not getting a deposit refund has never happened to us in 30 years of traveling , I think St Vincents knows credit card companies are reluctant to dispute and are ripping people off - beware.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and decent (for the price)”
Reviews.Author: cmt87
Reviews.Content: After reading some horrible reviews- I was nervous about staying here. I stayed in a private room. The sheets and towels and bathroom were clean. The floor was a little dirty, but not bad. The staff was very friendly and helpful. For such a good price- it is not bad at all!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: HeyDayDay
Reviews.Content: There is a reason they have a NO REFUNDS policy! Bugs everywhere, dirty rooms, window panes missing, no AC, elevator doesn't exist that I could find, I could go on and on!!! I would never recommend this place if it were free!

Reviews.Title: “Mardi Gras Week 2012”
Reviews.Author: LaurenAnneMarchese
Reviews.Content: I have read many of the reviews posted here about St. Vincent's. My sister and I stayed here this past week the three days following Mardi Gras. It is a bit of a walk to get to the French Quarter, but the grounds and grande old building are BEAUTIFUL! It used to be an Infant Orphan Asylum and has so many photographs from the older days, old painted posters from the Civil War, fifteen foot windows, just magnificent. Now, to all you who had ney to say...it is an old building. It is in New Orleans, one of the muggiest places on the planet. You can only do so much to make a place built more than 150 years ago look immaculate. Do not expect The Plaza. You are booking a hostel. We had fresh linens, towels, wash clothes, and a ceiling fan. The shower had hot water and the door had a working lock and chain. The staff made a mistake with our deposit but gladly rectified it before the end of our stay and could NOT have been friendlier!!!! We had NO BUGS in our room (private room, 2 Queen beds, bathroom included). It had obviously been freshly cleaned and linened. I did find VERY interesting some of the paranormal history of the hostel. We had a few experiences, and heard of many more....from guests and overheard from staff ( yes, I am sorry, I eavesdropped....curiosity!). It added to the charm and history of the place. Although Mom thought it was a bit dodgy after looking at the reviews of others, MY EXPERIENCE was overall WAAAAYYY POSITIVE!!! I am thinking about moving to NOLA and would definitely look to St. Vincent's for weekly or monthly rates to start off my stay. The Garden District (where SV is located, border), is beautiful....many quaint shops and eateries and a close walk to Lafayette Cemetery No. 1. St. Vincent's was, to me, the epitome of olde world N'awlins charm and grace. The other guests I met where friendly and wished they'd had a private room. When you stay in a dorm setting, you must expect other people to be dirty....not everyone showers, washes the counter, or cleans up after themselves the way you do. If you don't want that, GET A PRIVATE ROOM. It is tedious trying to clean up after 80 individuals at all hours of the day and book rezzies and work the front desk and refresh linens for 75 rooms and answer the phones and take care of breakfast and look after the vending machine and pool and mopping and vacuuming!!! Give the staff a break. I was happy to get warm friendly faces with a smile through obvious tire. Thank you for an unforgettable holiday and I hope to see you again soon.....MGR.: if you are reading this, please respond with an email so I may contact you about long-stay options in the near future! Ta!!

Reviews.Title: “Very basic accomodation”
Reviews.Author: waterskier82
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with my boyfriend as we were attending Mardi Gras. First, a couple of good points: The location is fantastic! We watched the parades from St Charles Avenue, had dinner at Voodoo BBQ (near by) and it has a great coffee shop across the road (Mojos). It was also within walking distance to Canal St (half hour max on a busy night) and Bourbon St (40 minutes max). Now to the bad: Check in staff are average at best. Be sure to keep all receipts of what you have paid. The rooms are a basic 1* hotel quality, the bathrooms were a shower (with curtain) and toilet (which flushed ok sometimes) and the hand basin was in the room. The floors were not spotless, the rooms were cold (although there was a smal bar heater in the room) and overall, I would not ever stay here again. The price, for Mardi Gras week/weekend was good value for the location, and if you can tolerate no housekeeping for your stay and basic rooms, then this is your place. There is no room safe and the door lock was somewhat dodgy. The room walls are paperthin and it is very noisy at night time with people outside in the courtyard area. If you want a nice warm shower, with a nice hotel room to relax in, this is NOT your place. If you want somewhere that is in a good spot, don't care about cleanliness and just want a bed to rest, this could be your place. Overall, this is probably the worst place I have stayed in in my 30 years, however it served its purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Screwed out of a "fully refundable" pet deposit.”
Reviews.Author: Tim C
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at St. Vincent's under the agreement that I would be getting a COMPLETE pet deposit refund back in the amount of $100 if the room sustained no damage from the pet, which it didn't. Before I booked, I was told in an email by one of the (thieving) owners, Dianne, that this was their pet policy. This was confirmed again via telephone with the other owner, Peter, before I checked in. I thought, "great, everyone is on the same page." WRONG. So I checked in and checked out under the same premise that I would be fully reimbursed $100, and my receipt also reflected that my deposit of $100 was FULLY refundable. Since I put the pet deposit on my credit card, I had to wait a bit for the refund to process and reflect in my bank account after I checked out. So, two weeks later I find out that only $70 was put back into my account, not the full $100. Now wait a second, this wasn't the quote previously agreed upon (by both owners!!). When I called the heistel, I mean hostel, (multiple times mind you) to find out what was going on, I was met with a lot of employees who didn't know what was going on with the situation. The incompetent staff took down messages for me, but I was never called back. Some days I would call and no one would pick up at all. After a week of this, I finally got a hold of the manager, Brandy. She told me that it wasn't the owners job to do the bookings in the first place, and that they misquoted me (not my problem!!). She also said that I was lucky to get $70 back! As if they have screwed other people over in the past for the full $100! She said that she talked to the owners and they said that this "was a closed case" and that there is nothing she could do about it. She apologized and said that "every hotel has a non-refundable pet deposit". BLANTANT THIEVERY! I was also never given Dianne's or Peter's phone number like I asked. I also emailed Dianne and Peter at the contact address listed on their website, but never got a response. You would think that the owners (DIANNE AND PETER) would at least own up to their screw-up and compensate me for the remaining money of the deposit, but no. I will never stay here again, and I will make sure my friends don't either. BOTTOM LINE: NO ACCOUNTABILITY AND NO TRANSPARENCY ON THE OWNER'S PART. INCOMPETENT STAFF AND WORSE OWNERS WHO DON'T MIND RIPPING PEOPLE OFF. AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS!!! THE PLACE WAS SUPER NOISY ON TOP OF IT. THIS PLACE SUCKS. Just to add, here is the initial email thread when I first booked the room: reservation st vincent email x tim Cone 12/1/11 to stvreservations Hi! I was wondering if I could make a reservation from Wednesday, January 4th - Saturday, January 7th. I am looking for a private room with two beds. There will be 3 people and one small dog. Please let me know if this would work when you get a chance! Thanks! Dianne Anderson stvreservations@gmail.com 12/2/11 to me Hi Tim, we do have availability and the rate is $49 Wednesday and Thursday and $59 on Friday and Saturday. We accept pets with a $100 deposit that is fully refundable at the end of your stay. Just phone or e-mail to reserve. We request a one night deposit to guarantee the reservation. Cancellation is 72 hours. Cheers, Dianne

Reviews.Title: “Two days before new year's eve”
Reviews.Author: rubenchicago
Reviews.Content: Nice place and affordable Room size was good Free Parking!! Clean Bathroom needs improve the cleaning excelent location safe nice staff

Reviews.Title: “Flithy and Dangerous, Padlocked and Chained shut fire escapes”
Reviews.Author: Light F
Reviews.Content: Our Group was called two weeks before arrival and told our rooms and reservations were canceled - after being pre-paid and pre-booked months ahead of time,Many heated phone calls later somehow we were reserved AGAIN. Too bad we insisted and checked in. I have been around the world 3 times and never seen filth like this, Sticky vomit? - stained carpets, Broken bed, Ceiling dripping god knows what onto the bed. Dirty sheets and a smell like old warm cat urine ... Unbelievably the windows were painted shut, and the 2 closest fire escapes were chained and padlocked shut!!!!! Broken - rotten rails on the second floor about 25 feet above pavement, And room doors that opened onto dangerously rotten second floor decks, With no marking or warning to stay off seems like a bad accident waiting to happen, Avoid this filthy, Dangerous dump at all cost!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Hell on Earth!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dennis S
Reviews.Content: IÂ´ve never seen an accommodation like this!!! The first impression was: It smells weed!!! Reception personal was HIGH!!!! First room they gave us was already occupied... We went back, they gave us another room. We entered the new room: smoke detector made noise, the bath was oily and dirty, behind the door hung a totally dirty towel with a lot of holes and the bed was completely dirty with hair and oil spots. Also, back to the front desk. After 20 minutes they gave us another room, the third, what was stinky, dirty and not a private room like we booked: it had 2 bunk beds. So, we put two matresses together in the floor and couldnÂ´t sleep afraid of insects. To top it of, the lights couldnÂ´t turn off. Instead of they were blinking like in a night club but actually it was a nightmare. We asked for a cancellation for the next day but they told us that only the main manager could do this and she would be back on the next day from 7:30am till 1:30pm... Next day: no manager at the front desk and no help with cancelation, refund or even to find another room. We decided to stay because we had no other possibility because all others hotels were sold out.

Reviews.Title: “CHARGED FOR NOT STAYING!”
Reviews.Author: Keaton S
Reviews.Content: A firend and I made reservations on Sunday 12/4/11 and both cancelled them after reading reviews posted on this site on 12/05/11. We were both charged $70.26 for cancelling our reservation well before the 1/05/12 deadline.

Reviews.Title: “ONLY if you CRAZY and BLIND!!”
Reviews.Author: Chris P
Reviews.Content: I checked in with wife into a private room for VACATION...we literally slept with one eye open and felt like we has creepy crawlies all night long...I stepped on a roach while walking to the bathroom on the carpet that looked it was covered in vomit. the bed was sagging and terrible and the bed cover was full of cigarette holes and burn marks. The people cleaning are definitely on crack and all they do is pour bleach all over but you can't really get that place clean. I was supposed to stay 5 nights but left after one for this great b&b around the corner. i definitely paid more but at least I came out a live and bedbug free. The place is nasty its that simple. if you like nasty it's the place for you - or if you're homeless. The biggest shame is that the place CAN be nice if they put in a little bit of money. It's huge and has great form, but it's right now a rundown sh**hole. It will ruin your trip if you stay there take it from someone who was just there this past weekend. I wish i would have done my research.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Clean, Affordable, GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Jonathon C
Reviews.Content: I checked in on a thurs night, easy to find, easy to park, and for FREE! I beleive the owner helped me check in, went smoothly, they had lots of info about whats around and how to get to the quarter. The accomodations were decent, charming, and clean. Nothing special, very basic. Shower was great. I spent a total of 15hrs in my hotel room, and was only a $10 cab ride from the quarter, but during the day I walked through the garden distric, down st charles to downtown, it was a nice walk about 30min, but you can always take trolly. I actually crashed on my friends hotel floor on sat night, and showered there the next morning. It was the Inn on Burbon, and that was also a basic room, with a crappy shower, after staying there i felt better about the $180 i spent for 3 nights vs the $600 my friend spent for 3 nights plus parking. Plus Uptown is much more affordable as far as eating vs the quarter, and the quality is better. Check out Coulis for Breakfast!! I suggest for a more comfortable stay to bring, your own pillow and towel. Like I said its very basic. This is a diamond in the rough. If you love New Orleans for its charm, you will love this place. Its ballin on a budget, and I will for sure stay there over and over again when I visit New Orleans. Only issue was doors were locked after 2am on thurs. Just ring bell, and flash your key to the groundsman, at least thats what I did. I never had any other issues getting in on fri night. Save ur $$ and stay here. This place is legit. As far as beg bugs, they were non existant. They really take care of this place, and I hope it always stays affordable. Like i said diamond in the rough.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place like the plague”
Reviews.Author: SaintVictim
Reviews.Content: This place is incompetently managed and they make no effort to insure the safety of their guests or their guests' property. There was someone who went into the dorm while I was sleeping late Saturday night/ early Sunday morning and stole my backpack, wallet, money, etc. The thief HAD A KEY to the dorm. When I went to the front desk to report it, the manager (Brandy) asked me if I was drunk. I informed her that someone using a key had stolen my things and then I went to speak to a police officer. While I was speaking to the officer, the manager put somebody else on the front desk and then left the property. After I spoke to the police and prepared to go to work I told the girl at the front desk that they needed to change the lock. I returned that evening and found they never did. Late last night, someone else had their backpack stolen from the same dorm. Not only did they not change the lock, but they turned right around and rented a bunk in the same dorm to another patron. He awoke this morning to find that his backpack had been stolen. I suppose they haven't considered that one of these days someone might catch the thief in the act and get injured or killed in the process. They could avoid all of these problems by keeping track of the keys, but apparently that's a little too much like work for them. Simply charging a key deposit would ensure that more keys are returned. At this point, I can't even be sure that it wasn't an employee.who's doing the stealing.But since this morning marked the third time in a month that this has happened, they have NO excuse. This is not an isolated incident. If you value your safety and property, don't stay here. These people are negligent, incompetent, and the manager is very rude.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Shaun C
Reviews.Content: I came in for a short weekend and this place was the best! As I am part of the 'older' crowd, Bruce gave me a quieter room off of the parlor. Was perfect, tiny, and comfortable...Staff always had a friendly hello as I would pass in and out, and always were pleasant when I asked questions about locations, history, and activities. If you love charming old places with a great history, this is the spot. Rustic, but perfect for me. I will definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “passing through again.............”
Reviews.Author: debbie t
Reviews.Content: I love this old hotel that was an orphanage...the owner Peter is an awesome person and a friend to boot I have worked in this hotel and if u look on 2nd floor i done all the painting in hallways and also alot of the rooms..he gave me free reighn to color scheme and although this is not the Waldorf he charges far less than alot of hotels in New Orleans ..and as far as bed bugs there has been cases but he is immediately on top of it and u figure people are coming from all over the world i would recommend this place to anyone and hope to be back there son..debbie tidewell

Reviews.Title: “Rundown, but people were friendly, eclectic”
Reviews.Author: felinefrenz
Reviews.Content: The people were great but the accomodations left a lot to be desired. Beds were a little lumpy, tv did not receive well. But, once again, the area was charming and we liked the people. This building is an old children's orphanage with a lot of history behind it. The large great room was friendly and inviting and the grounds were pretty nice.

Reviews.Title: “Barely Tolerable”
Reviews.Author: scarlet99
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group of law students on Spring Break from Chicago doing volunteer work in the Lower 9th Ward. We were arriving the weekend after Mardi Gras, and so accomodations were hard to find for a group. We settled on St. Vincent's Guest House, and we actually stayed in one of the manager's private quarters on the first floor. During and after Mardi Gras when demand is high, apparently the manager moves all his furniture out and sets up bunk beds in what is essentially a one bedroom apartment. There is a fan in the bedroom, but the window doesn't open. Can't speak to the state of the other regular hostel rooms as we didn't see them. There were 12 of us crammed into that space. I had never stayed in a hostel before, and after St. Vincent's I probably won't again. The place just didn't look or feel clean. We did receive fresh linens when we checked in, though some us opted to bring our own. The weather the week we were there would have been warm enough to go in the pool, but it looked slimy. Some of the people working at St. Vincent's are also quite questionable. I tried to stay out of the room as much as possible, so in the mornings and evenings before and after volunteering I would sit out at the table out front by the fountain, and was approached a few times by people that worked at St. Vincent's who were clearly under the influence of something during work hours. Strange. Convenient that there is a coffee shop across the street. Decent area, within walking distance of the Street Car or a short cab ride to the French Quarter. You can tell the property used to be a grand old place. It just needs to be thoroughly scrubbed down and aired out.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, avoid this place. Denied we had reservations.”
Reviews.Author: Baffling_Experience
Reviews.Content: We were traveling to NOLA to attend a big education conference, so made a reservation by email, then called and left a credit card deposit to make sure we had a room. But when we arrived the person at the front desk was rude, denied we had a reservation and said there were no available single rooms due to plumbing trouble; they showed us a dorm room they said we could stay in, which was awful, hot, packed with sleeping people. Essentially, this place is an SRO. While we were in the lobby calling hotels to see if we could find a room elsewhere, several other guests who said they had confirmations, including a poor European couple, were also turned away. As we waited for these folks to finish trying to get a room we noticed a folder with our names and a copy of our credit card receipt, sitting on the front desk. Only when we pointed that out to the desk person did she admit that there was in fact a single room available. At that point we were desperate so we took the room, but the whole experience was awful. I'm still not sure if they were lying all along, and waiting for a bribe or something to get our room, which we had already paid for one night in, "released" to us, or if something else was going on. Creepy. Save yourself some grief and avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “Close to downtown. It was cheap but run down and needs some TLC”
Reviews.Author: stones80123
Reviews.Content: We wanted a place to stay in New Orleans withing walking distance to the downtown area that would not break our bank account. We checked into this guest house around 9pm in the evening in a makeshift parking lot. The check-in process was fine since we were charged in advance. Our room was a decent size and we had a nice view of the parking lot. The pillows were very small and the bed was very uncomfortable. The carpet was threadbare and my wife came across a pubic hair from a previous guest. The internet did not work in the room and you had to go into the hallway or downstairs. This place needs to consider completing some serious renovations even for $50 per night plus tax. A major plus is that you can walk downtown in 20 minutes or take a free shuttle during the day. We chose to get some exercise and walk.

Reviews.Title: “I Loved It During My Short Time There! ;-)”
Reviews.Author: carolyn c
Reviews.Content: Well, I can see most of you liked my old home....Although some didn't and that's ok. Hi, my name is Carolyn. I use to live at St. Vincents as a baby, until a few months old, when I was so lucky to be adopted by the most two wonderful parents. They gave me the name of Carolyn. I have gone back and the kind lady at the front desk showed me around and showed me the room where my parents would have first seen me and received me from the hands of the nuns, The Sisters of Charity. I have a vague memory of t he Sisters caring for me.... Hey, it might not be the Ritz,....but Christ was born in a stable you know, and maybe he sent you there for a reason. The ones who complained, that's ok. You were sent there for a reason, and maybe that reason is to come down a peg or two in your life and be grateful for all you have. You know it's all about perspective....Imagine how beautiful St. Vincents would look to a completely Homeless Person. Take Care everyone, and thanks to my wonderful Mom and dad for coming to get me at St. Vincnet sand giving me a wonderful life! I love you both so much. I am now 56 years old. St. Vincents is the most beautiful place n the words for me. It gave me my mom and dad, old bedspreads, bare thin carpet and all ! Thank you Jesus for St. Vincents!

Reviews.Title: “Sensible expectaions for a grand old property"”
Reviews.Author: LonesomeRoads
Reviews.Content: First, I will be frank ..this is a Hostel/Guesthouse in a grand antebellum sprawling building. Having lived in old houses in New Orleans before, I was prepared for the "musty" smell that comes with these places. While just walking down the "beautiful" area of Magazine where this Guesthouse is located you will often smell the "musty provenance" emitting from these houses. The rooms were average to better than average (for this genre). This is NOT a hotel. The shower curtain needed to be thrown away. Come on guys they cost a buck. The furniture is a mismatched hodge podge that mimics the eccentric clientele. The common areas were clean and the pool was a respite from the heat. If you don't like your room , ask to be moved. There could be improvement in room cleaning procedures and there were NO bedbugs. This place has a lot of ambience and history plus location (great). If your expectations are for a hotel...not for you. If you like a little adventure and a "Chelsea" like vibe ....without the rock stars and SId and Nancy then you will like this place. Staff friendly , if a little pre-occupied. I am relocating and planning on staying a month before I rent an apartment.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL/HOSTEL OF ALL TIME”
Reviews.Author: shawshankredeemer
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY AT ST VINCENT'S GUESTHOUSE, AVOID AT ALL COSTS. We booked over the phone and were told our stay would cost us $60 for 3 nights, which we thought was such a good deal that we could not resist. HOW WE REGRET THIS! Upon arrival, we discovered that our stay would in fact be $180 instead of just $60. Our room was boiling hot and smelt terrible. We were so hot we could barely sleep. Then, I woke up covered in bed bug bites, such serious bites, in fact, that I ended up having to visit an emergency doctor and get an injection to prevent me from getting even more ill. We reported this to the receptionist, she was unapologetic and impolite. We left after 1 night, and instead of writing the real reason for our departure, bed bugs, on our request for a refund, she wrote 'family emergency', when she knew full well that this was not the case, resulting in us not receiving the full refund that we deserved. This experience ruined our time in New Orleans and I would not wish it upon anyone. Avoid the St Vincents Guesthouse at all costs!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite place to stay in NOLA!”
Reviews.Author: alanter
Reviews.Content: We absolutely LOVE staying here! Everytime we visit New Orleans, we make St. Vincent Guesthouse our home away from home! The history and architecture are amazing! The staff is so friendly and the experience is very unique!

Reviews.Title: “Third time staying here and have loved it every time.”
Reviews.Author: Dempshouse
Reviews.Content: St Vincent's is a historical, enjoyable place to stay. The staff are very friendly and helpful on places to visit and places to eat. The rates are very reasonable and it is also a very unique establishment with many amenities. Pets are also welcomed. I love staying here everytime I visit New Orleans. A special thank you to Maggie for all her help on my last stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fleas”
Reviews.Author: AleFuentes
Reviews.Content: I think the title sais what I need you to know, first night and i woke up in the middle of the night with those things on the bed, 2 days later my girlfriend had all these bites around her back and one of her arms.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place I've ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: blntklly
Reviews.Content: This place should be condemned! The rooms are dirty, the staff are rude, the place is falling apart and it's full of crackheads!

Reviews.Title: “St. Vincent's Guest House is my New Orleans Home”
Reviews.Author: AllisonJo
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed in New Orleans at St. Vincent's for three weeks. I adore this place. Most the staff live on the property; therefore, they truly care for their home. The pool and courtyard are beautiful. We were traveling with our two cats and dog. St. Vincent's is very animal friendly. I felt comfortable riding my bike at all hours with or without my fiance. The area has become much more populated since the previous reviews. If you are looking for a place where the staff tosses pedals at your feet, this is not the place for you. However, if you like to fend for yourself and bring your own shampoo then I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “they have a long way to go...”
Reviews.Author: sibbers83
Reviews.Content: when approaching the building, it looks absolutely magnificent and when you enter you still feel the same but unfortunately when you enter the dorm, you feel very dissapointed. the 20 bed dorm was pretty disgusting and was obviously not cared for. the bathroom had enough pubic hair to make a bald man very happy.... the main problem witht his hostel is the occupants. most of them are obviously long stays and many have differents issues with things like mental health, alcohol addiction, and other social needs. although none of them made me feel threatened, their behaviour could be intimidating when you returned back to the hostel. Dont get me wrong everyone was friendly, but it is maybe not appropriate to have people who are basically living there and people who are on holiday stay all together. It made it very difficult to complain as some of them work on front desk and you don't want to cause any offence. when discussing the dorms i was told that it is too difficult to clean them when people leave their stuff everywhere. However, the hostel was making some positive changes and were making a consciencous effort to make it more inviting to travellers. while i was there they were doing some building work etc. they have a swimming pool, but i am not sure how well maintained it was. i was also told by other guests that the private rooms were lovely and very clean. unfortunately i did have a horrible experience with bedbugs but in defence America is having an issue but if the dorm isnt cleaned, hoovered etc then the problem will only get worse. the actual hostel is based in the lower garden district which is actually very nice. it is a far walk into the french quarter if you are expecting to stay close to town. it takes about 25 mins to walk, otherwise there is a tram that takes you all the way in and it only cost $1.25. i actually felt quite safe in this area as new orleans is well known to have areas you shouldnt walk alone in. overall if you wanted an over stay, if you can cope with bedbugs, or were planning to have a private room; here would be fine. honestly, i wouldnt recommend single females to stay here and i wouldnt recommend it. but if they made changes, i think it could be a really nice place to stay....

Reviews.Title: “If you can get beyond the overcrowded dorms, the lax security, and the slightly sketchy guests - the pool is a blessing!”
Reviews.Author: RachelBL
Reviews.Content: The good: This hostel has a saltwater pool - such a blessing when New Orleans is so so hot - this if anything totally redeemed the hostel for us as my friends and I spent a lot of time in here! The staff were also very, very friendly, helpful and laid back (although one guy did make a little mistake with our deposit but then he took some money off). They offered us towels and toiletries as well as bedding and allowed my friend to store his guitar in the office for our stay. There was also free wifi which was very high speed! The common space is the building and the general historical architecture was also rather pleasing - there were a lot of plush sofas and a huge dayroom as well as picnic tables outside in the garden/pool area. The restaurant was also a very good stop for breakfast - $3 got you a egg, sausage and cheese biscuit. Location wise - the number 11 bus stops right outside, the cable car is a couple of blocks away and even walking, it's only about 20 minutes to the French Quarter. So, now the bad: So we stayed here for 3 nights last week in a 22 bed dorm. We were prepared for staying in a big dorm but we assumed that whilst it would be big, the dorm would also be spacious (we all had big backpacks). This wasn't the case - the room was jammed to the full with beds with the 'aisles' in between so small only one person could get through at a time. My mattress was also rather uncomfortable - I felt like I was sleeping on planks, although most in the room were fine. There were also no security codes/keys on the doors (one which led directly outside) which meant we had no choice but to store all our valuables in a locker. There were two bathrooms attached, which were a bit on the dirty and run down side with a few bugs and the showers were small. Unfortunately, our air conditioning broke while we were here - but the staff did fix this eventually and were good about keeping us updated on the situation. The hostel also had a bit of the feel of a 'halfway house' with a few long term residents - one guy came up to us and just started rattling of his DUIs, told us he was going into rehab, and then asked for one of our half drunk beers! But for the most the other guests were friendly and not scary - although just about half the crowd was over 30. It wouldn't be hard for this hostel to improve - just remove a few bunk beds from the dorms in the less busy guest periods to make them more comfortable for everyone and spruce up the bathrooms a bit. Also, maybe cut down on the length of stay people are allowed. The general building is a beautiful historical building and could be a really nice place to stay if a few little changes were made. I'm choosing not to recommend this to others - purely on the basis I wouldn't want to stay here alone - however, if you are with friends and want somewhere cheap (but with a pool!) - it's fine.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs are not okay in a professional establishment.”
Reviews.Author: d-rock7
Reviews.Content: I woke up covered in bed bug bites after a one night stay in my unsanitary private room. That should be all you need to know. If bed bugs come home with you in your luggage, it is very difficult and costly to get rid of them. This establishment should be closed down for negligence.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: shill514
Reviews.Content: I stayed at St. Vincent's in April and loved the rich history, cleanliness and friendly staff. I enjoyed the pool too! II'll go back again when I visit New Orleans next year.

Reviews.Title: “St. Vincent's Guest House Was a Costly Mistake”
Reviews.Author: daufuskielocal
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are adventurous travelers always looking for a good deal. My wife booked St. Vincent's for our weekend in New Orleans. First mistake is we arrived late, tired, and hungry....three keys to making a bad decision. We stayed one night and checked out the next morning assured we would not be charged for our booked nights but of course our bank statement shows they charged us for all 4 nights. I finally got credited for 2 nights but still payed for a something less than satisfactory and something that we did not even use. BTW, it took us about two weeks of calling to get a call back for the partial refund. The place was very dingy and dirty but we thought we would take a look at the room. It was as bad. Reluctantly, we decided to stay for fear we would have trouble finding a place to stay at 11pm. The bathroom was dirty and the bed had pubic hair in it and the sheets were dirty. The floors were musty and not vacuumed. The place sells itself as a non party atmosphere which compared to Bourbon street may be true but we had loud partying above us all night. All I can say is spend the extra money and don't bite this hook. Also, they are a long ways from the attractions. At least 1.5 miles through not so safe neighborhoods. Having this place as a home base would mean lots of cash spent on taxi's or more time walking than listening to good music. I would try VRBO.com...we ultimately found something 10 times nicer for just about $20 more per night and we were only two blocks from frenchmans street and lots of music.

Reviews.Title: “Ummmm, no.”
Reviews.Author: splice35mm
Reviews.Content: We aren't picky people, but given the chance, we would have vacated our room as soon as we saw it. The sign in the lobby that read, "NO REFUNDS UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES" immediately came to mind.... unfortunately, we had just paid for 5 nights. The room couldn't be described as scary, but close. Lousy bed with very pilled sheets with stains..... blankets too. We opted to wear flip-flops 100% of the time as the carpet was heavily worn and..... well.... scary. OK, the place is a little scary. The sparse furniture was beat up and/or broken. The bathroom was bad, but in fairness, it could have been worse. The plentiful hot water seemed like a miracle. Everything needed to be remodeled about 25 years ago. And that's just it.... it would seem the owner has all but given up on the place and is banking on having a continuous supply of new customers forever. We can't imagine anyone would willingly return to Saint Vincents at any price. THERE IS A BRIGHT SPOT! Three out of the four staff members were very nice. They seemed to give us that, "Yeah, we know" look. When we asked about a refund we were told that they had never seen anyone receive one, and that many people had tried. Got it. We considered jumping ship for the last few nights even without a refund, but in the end we sort of got used to the place. Lesson learned.... spend a little more money.... and definitely take a look at the room before you commit to so many nights!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: houshuang
Reviews.Content: The building looks nice, but that's about it. We had booked a two-person room, but when we first came, there had been some kind of flood, so we had to stay in the dorm for two nights (paying more for it! and no apologies!)... I have stayed in dorms in Asia, Europe and the US, and these were the worst I've ever seen - filthy, completely crammed, many of the beds and mattresses were broken, no place to put your luggage, etc. After two days, we got access to a two-person room. This room was much nicer - ensuite bathroom and (very noisy) air con, for a decent price. However, we were bitten horribly by bedbugs, and now I have apparently carried them home with me, causing a huge headache... Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hostel in town!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jokneip
Reviews.Content: We had a reservation for double rooms but on the day of arrival no rooms were available. It was French Quarter festival and we had a hard time to find another place. They offered dorms instead which were awful. Very dirty and smelly.

Reviews.Title: “It's really a rip off!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nonche1
Reviews.Content: We booked more than a week ago and St Vincent's Guesthouse charged our creditcard. However, when we arrived they told us there was no reservation, because of a problem with online booking sites. Unfortunately, there was nowhere else to stay. We made a reservation for a private room but eventually we were forced to agree to stay in a dorm room. The dorm room was filled with people who experienced the same treatment. Some were told there was a plumbing problem and others that there was a problem with the online booking. When we left the in the morning we told the staff that the dorm room was dirty, and that everbody in de dormroom was tolt different lies. But they don't seem to bother. New Orleans is a great town but this place is a great disappointment. We will never ever go here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: Questathon
Reviews.Content: I am not usually one to bash a hostel/hotel online. But in this case I feel it necessary to warn. I am yet another victim of bedbugs after staying at this hostel. The room we stayed in was relatively unclean, but for the price I could deal with it. The problem is I have since discovered I have bedbug bites and am currently taking proactive measures to ensure they have not followed me home. We checked the mattresses for bedbugs before settling in and found no signs of them.... but I am now covered in itchy bedbug bites.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T TRUST THIS PLACE....IT'S A RIP OFF...”
Reviews.Author: luverofpurple
Reviews.Content: I made reservations for this place during Mardi Gras 2011...they took my debit card information and was told to check in before midnight...when me and my friends showed up for our room at 5pm, we were told there were no reservations for us...so we had to end up staying somewhere else...two days later my credit card was debited for $156.00 dollars, but we had "no reservations"....how does that happen....I have called this place several times to resolve this matter and to no avail, no response no return phone calls. I will be calling the BBB to see if I can recover my money that was debited from my account. I am very dissatisfied and frustrated with my call being ignored by the St Vincent Guest House Manager/Owner. I was told by Sharon (accountant) that the owner who's name is Peter does not return phone calls and will not speak to anyone for any reason....REALLY???

Reviews.Title: “Won't do this again.”
Reviews.Author: misternas
Reviews.Content: The staff was as helpful and courteous as they could be but the conditions of this place were pretty bad. I tried to over look the roaches, I tried to overlook the dirt and dilapidated conditions because after all it is over 100 years old. But what I could not get past was the lack of air conditioning. It was averaging 75-80 degrees during our stay and the college group that I was with stayed in the dorms. For what we were charged, I found a decent local motel with clean rooms, plenty of towels, ample a/c, no bugs and saved $20 per room. I do want to say that the location of St. Vincent's was convenient to walk to Bourbon St. about a mile away. But I would rather pay more money for a hotel/motel closer with A/C and no humongous roaches.

Reviews.Title: “BEST VALUE IN NOLA!”
Reviews.Author: fsuchica72
Reviews.Content: My best friend & I made our first Mardi Gras trip this year. We booked St. Vincents and were pleasantly surprised. Close to the hip places in the garden district, St. Vincents has the friendliest staff in New Orleans. We met the owner who was very gracious. Everyone should stay here when they come to New Orleans. And at $90/night during Mardi Gras...you can't beat it

Reviews.Title: “i'd never go back!”
Reviews.Author: WoopWoopy
Reviews.Content: We booked online one week earlier, called ahead and they said everything was fine. However, when we arrived at the hotel, nothing was done: no reservation, no room. I guess they give us the worst rooms they have in that guest house. Stains on the sheets, on the walls. The ceiling is falling off and is full of holes. Moreover, there was no window in my room! I'd not even bring a hooker back in that room! I'm pretty sure hey have a couple of nice rooms but some of them are nasty and it stinks bad in there.

Reviews.Title: “Not clean at all”
Reviews.Author: AcidDC
Reviews.Content: Good Service People at the reception desk are very nice, and they will do whatever it takes to help you. Very Bad Product I booked 2 rooms ( 1 twin beds and 1 double bed ), and they were very dirty... Ceilings had plenty of stains, and holes, electricity cables were coming outside of the plugs, sheets had holes and stains as well, bathroom door did not close... If you're just looking for a bed to crash into then it is not that bad, but i would say the rooms are way not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: bbrpro
Reviews.Content: My time at St. Vincents was really great. I found the staff helpful and kind (especially Shane and Amber), the location unbeatable - close to uptown, downtown, and the French Quarter, and the amenities, while not luxe, sufficient. The food at the cafe was great, the pool was open and a nice break from unusually warm February weather, the free wi-fi 24/7 a bargain, and the courtyard a great place to relax with a bottle of wine. St. Vincent's definitey isnt posh, but it was a safe, comfy place with a cool mix of both New Orleans characters and travellers. I would def recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “No heat and poor customer service by management”
Reviews.Author: jeannineDallas_TX
Reviews.Content: I reserved a double room in the â€œhotelâ€� portion of St. Vincentâ€™s 2 months in advance. Upon arrival I was charged for the entire 4 nights immediately. When I was shown to the room I discovered there was NO HEAT. The room is clearly advertised as having heat on their website. Since the overnight temperature was expected to be in the low 30s and the â€œcomforterâ€� was nothing more than a thin blanket and I was running in the New Orleans marathon that weekend, I decided to checkout. The front desk lady offered me the space heater from her own room on my way out, but it was ridiculously small for a 14 foot high ceiling and tile floor room. Since my checkout the manager and owner have refused to refund my payment even though I was in the room for less than 30 minutes. I realize itâ€™s not often you need heat in the South, but if they will false advertise about this, what else? Donâ€™t take the chance. PS the air conditioner unit looked extremely questionable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Staff x Bad Bugs”
Reviews.Author: LeandroPaiacan
Reviews.Content: People who work there are really great, nice vibe, friendly, no problems. However, we find out in our first morning bedbugs! The staff put us in a better (and clean) room and washed all our clothes, which was ok until I realized that all my socks and white tshirts were now blue. Even with these problems I recommend, the place is full of history and nice people. Check for bugs before sleep!

Reviews.Title: “what a treat”
Reviews.Author: dessiem2000
Reviews.Content: My family recently stayed at st Vincents gust house and I must say I don't understand why some of these reviews are so bad It is not only a beautiful older building with lovely courtyards and sitting areas but the rooms are quite large and very beautiful. As an added treat we found out from the staff (who was so overly helpful) that we actually stayed in the same room as Bruce Willis and Morgan freeman when they were filming "red" how amazing. my children will always remember it. I would definitely stay here again and bring my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place: extremely dirty, disloyal and disorganized staff”
Reviews.Author: Noluogo82
Reviews.Content: I have travelled quite a lot and in many places in camping areas and hostels but I would not recommend this place to anybody... It might be a personal and isolated bad experience but I don't think so... The hostel is ina good position and the ancient and colonial building is really fascinating but the staff of the place is unreliable and the rooms very dirty. To give you an idea of our experience: I had reserved well in advance for me and other friends but my room was assigned to somebodyelse the morning of our arrival and they hadn't even realized it since they gave us the keys and we entered in somebodyelse's room with all his/her stuff there... so, at the end, we were assigned another room that was almost a cave, very humid, dirty, without air condition and with all sort of animals all around. They assured us that we would have been placed in another and convenient room the day after but when we asked, the following day, about such change the same woman answered in a very rude way saying that they were overbooked and that it was only our problem. When we asked for at least some cleaning of the room, the staff member sent to clean the room - ironically - came just with a piece of toilet paper in order to pretend to take from the ground some of the cigarettes, insects, hair and other trash from the previous occupants of the room, that covered the floor. Some of our friends had other bad experiences, having a room crawl with fleas which bited them during the night. In addition, we decided to leave one day earlier and asked the doorman if this was possible - despite the standard non-refund policy - to get the money back for that nigh and he said "of course, we are overbooked so it's a deal for both of us. We will refund you in 2 days". When we wrote some weeks later having received no money back, they denied everything.

Reviews.Title: “Total frauds”
Reviews.Author: wonderlustmag
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this in the hope we will actual get our refund. We stayed here a night, and were charged twice for it, my partner has been back at least five times to get his $50 refund, showed them his bank statement, reciept, talked to them face to face and sent plenty of emails. We are living in New Orleans so have the luxury to go and tell them to refund us, but they are being so slack about it and lying, saying it's been sorted out, but this happened at least a month a go. the place is total decrepit and not worth staying at. To the Manager, if you are reading this we need our refund! It was your staff who screwed up and you need to pay up!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Terrific Location and Excellent Staff!”
Reviews.Author: anitaboucher
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at St. Vincent's 4 or 5 times now, and it gets better each time! This is not a lavish place, but the rooms are just fine and I sleep like a baby at night! The building is very old, historic in fact, which is why it can seem a little dusty to folks who are used to the big chain hotels, but I have NEVER seen a single bug in my room EVER!!! The property is unique and charming. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. I plan to visit St. Vincent's again the next time I'm in NOLA. I like the neighborhood because you can walk or take a bus or streetcar almost anywhere, and the surrounding blocks have really cool shops, affordable restaurants and a hip atmosphere in general. There's even a pool and a barbecue in the courtyard! St. Vincent's Guesthouse is the best kept secret in New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Miserable, dirty and infested”
Reviews.Author: LondonBarbd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St Vincent Guesthouse in late August and were completely disappointed in the place. The room was basic, which generally isn't a problem for me - but there was bug powder around the entire room and we were bitten by some kind of insects during the nights. The breaking point came when we found a cockroach in our luggage. We were on a two month road trip around the US, staying in some pretty basic places, and camping where necessary. I would say that this guesthouse gave us our WORST accommodation of the whole trip. I noticed that the General Manager has commented a previous complaint by saying that they've had no guest complaints about bug infestations for a month prior to September 15th. This is a lie. We moved out after strongly complaining about our cockroach experiences on the 20th August. He know this because we asked for a refund which - despite the staff assuring us we would be forthcoming - has not materialised yet. In fact he lied to us on multiple occasions about calling us back to discuss the matter further. My advice to anyone planning on a stay is: don't, there are way nicer places to stay for a similar amount of money in NOLA. It might just ruin your experience of the whole place. The one saving grace were the staff on the front desk, who tried to be as accommodating as they could be, given the circumstances...

Reviews.Title: “A nifty place to stay if you love the history and eligance of New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Morningdeer
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed there for 4 days. It was kind of expensive for 4 days but it was an alright place. I did not have any bed bugs or fleas or any of that. We did not find any roaches in the hall ways. The staff was so friendly to us. We would go out on the balcony and they would walk by and ask us how were doing, just so nice. yes, the lobby was hot but they leave the doors open and its not that cool in Louisiana. I slept perfectly fine every night. Everything worked fine in my room. The night we got there i was a little hesitant to staying there but the next morning i actually saw how remarkable it is. it used to be an old orphanage and you can tell it has history flowing out of it. there is an awesome coffee shop right across the street. and its not far from Canal St. or Bourbon St. Its just a neat place to stay. The only thing i found wrong with it is that my room didnt have a remote haha but its all good. Its not a hotel people its a guest house. if you want more towels or toilet paper youre going to have to go and get it yourself from the lobby. so all in all i liked it very much. oh and one more thing, at night the wind would blow so hard the door to the balcony, right by my room, would slam against the wall it scared the mess outta me so many times haha so ya might wanna put some doorstoppers down. but i enjoyed my stay. thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Its a historical place thats reasonable..not a castle!!”
Reviews.Author: cajuncandy
Reviews.Content: We went last year and had a great time. Our rooms wasnt like a five star hotel but they were ok. There were no bed begs, but we really didnt spend much time sleeping in our bed because theres just so much to do in New Orleans. It is a interesting place to stay though and the hotel staff was very nice. We just wanted an inexpensive place to crash after partying!! I wouldnt recommend bringing kids....but its a nice cozy place to stay with your love or friends!! They even locked up the hotel at night ...we came in one morning at 3:00 am and had to bang on the door, then a sweet lil lady came out in her robe and let us in....she reminded me of my mom I felt really safe!!!

Reviews.Title: “Peter Schreiber, the owner is a crook!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jaybutta3k
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the worst hotel in all of New Orleans. I made reservations to stay there but canceled later on due to finding closer accommodations to the attractions. My cancellation was well within the cancellation policy set forth by the hotel, and the owner still will not refund my money. He will not even return a call or even answer my phone call. Manager claims that he is always out or busy. What a ripoff. DO NOT STAY HERE, you'd get better service at a Motel 6.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE MANAGEMENT & HOSPITALITY”
Reviews.Author: jasonrs
Reviews.Content: This has to be the worst place I have ever stayed. I was sickened by the conditions of the rooms, hallways, front desk, and lobby. As soon as I walked in I realized it was hotter at the front desk than it was outside. The lady at the front desk was drinking vodka. When I asked to speak to the manager, she said she was the manager. I was told there was air conditioning in the rooms. When I got to the room the A/C didn't work. There were also bed bugs so big I could see them. Dead roaches in the hallways, no towels in the room. I went down to the front desk to get a refund. The manager told me there was nothing she could do. There were no more rooms and they don't give refunds. I unfortunately had a week booked. I spent as little time there as possible. Every night when I would get back from exploring New Orleans. I would look forward to taking a swim. The pool was the one good looking thing there. Unfortunately the Manager would be in the pool drinking with several men and being very inappropriate. The guys were usually doing cannonball's and splashing obnoxiously.

Reviews.Title: “Until they put a million dollars into the place and kick the crackheads out, don't go.”
Reviews.Author: rockkey42
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in the dorms and had the worst night sleep I'd had in months. There were fleas in the beds, roaches all over the kitchen, people's things were being stolen out of their locked private rooms and the majority of the people living there were shady people from the city. In an emergency get a private room, but don't stay long. One plus was the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great neighborhood, salt-water pool, haunted hotel.”
Reviews.Author: minna18
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I, along with a dozen high school students on a service trip to the New Orleans area, stayed at St. Vincent's. The building is a historic former orphanage, reputedly haunted (our students spent an enjoyably-creepy hour after dark, searching the hallways with thermal-image apps on their phones). The proprietor and everyone on staff were helpful and friendly. The salt-water pool was a real bonus in the hot weather; the on-site laundry was useful (though keep an eye on your drying clothes--other folks will jack your drier time). The surrounding neighborhood is wonderful--snow-cone stands, good restaurants, lots of shops, easy access to streetcars to the French Quarter--but not noisy. St. Vioncent's is NOT luxurious, but if you are happy with reasonable comfort in a much-better-than-the-usual-travelers'-hostel place, with the amenities described, for an economical price, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and amenities for our school group.”
Reviews.Author: seattlescone
Reviews.Content: The staff at St. Vincent's took great care of our group (two adults and 12 high school students) during our recent stay. Travelers may trade the shiny new features of chain hotel when staying at St. Vincent, but this beautiful historic building has tons of charm. Not to mention the location, pool, laundry services, and courtyard. At twice the price it's still a amazing deal. A big bonus is the coffee shop right across the street. Rooms are simple and clean. 24 hour staff were kind and helpful. A great place to stay for a budget traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I ever used during my entire life, no exaggeration”
Reviews.Author: goodtripsarebest
Reviews.Content: I am a no or low-frills gal, but this place was unacceptable. I seriously question how this place continues to attract clients as it is indeed the worst hospitality establishment I visited anywhere in the world--worse than any place I stayed in the U.S., Mexico or Europe. Period. I organized my review into key points, so you can go with whichever topic is most important to you. Making reservations: The hotel representative who took my reservation over the phone was the surliest, rudest hotel rep I have ever encountered, even worse than the one years ago who wouldn't rent a hotel room because he though we were Mexican. I should have known then that this would be a bad place, but I just thought it must have been a one-off person or a bad day for that person. The rep made sure to tell me that they were going to charge my credit card right then whether or not I showed up that evening. : / Price: It was something like $100/night, which is inexpensive relative to other places. It was not worth ten dollars, however, and I would definitely spend the extra money for a better place, if I was you. Location: The location was great and is the only reason to stay at this place. You are close to the bus stop, but the bus was over 25 minutes late, no joke. We just walked the additional blocks to the street car instead and took it around town. At least the place is located in a fun neighborhood with lots of shops and people walking around and hanging out. Room: Unacceptable. Just unacceptable. And I am one of those people who stayed in hostels, lived on a mountain and worked on camp grounds and am not a wuss. Trust me. The room was bad, people. This is how stingy the room was: You know how no and low frills places just provide two little soaps and one tiny bottle each of cheap shampoo, conditioner and maybe lotion? Ok, this place had one of those little soaps and that's it. The tv did not have a remote. Oh, it wasn't the remote-chained-to-the-tv, which I've seen or the one that you have to check out from the front desk, which I've also done, but just completely absent. The bathroom had one roll of toilet paper. Frankly, I'm surprised they even gave us a towel. The bed was broken and at a steep angle on one corner but you couldn't see it until you sat on it. The sheet had a cigarette burn hole in it. Just unbelievable. Forget about in-room coffee machine or telephone. The wifi didn't work in the room at all, which really irritated me because I specifically asked if they had wifi. I still had to work and respond to client emails while on the trip. I had to sit right next to the desk on the first floor to get enough of a signal just to get the most basic online work finished. Parking: There was a parking lot beside the building. No charge for parking. I wouldn't trust my car to be safe here, though, so I took absolutely everything out of it. There were people just hanging out watching me do it, so I felt doubly paranoid about someone breaking into the car. Great Room: This room epitomizes the character of this place. All of the furniture is antique, but it is utterly shabby, neglected, stained, ripped, torn antique, not hip, on a budget, dinged but lovingly refurbished antique. There are very few outlets, as the place has not been updated outside of an ugly coat of paint. The room supposedly has the wifi signal, but I did not find that to be the case *anywhere in the room.* This place is just bad, guys. I never would recommend this place to a friend nor would I ever return to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as in some reviews, but still not great”
Reviews.Author: NausicaaNL
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hostel because there were no other hotels available due to the Jazz fest. Upon arrival I was very tired of flying 20 hours, the airline loosing my luggage and the high humidity, but the desk clerk still thought it was a good moment to joke around with everyone else as well as me before helping me, which was very annoying. I had a private room, which was pretty big. It was not the cleanest I have ever seen (floor was sticky, dust in corners etc, there was a plant growing all the way into the bathroom from the outside), but the sheets and towels were clean. Other than in some reviews my door locked properly, and I did not feel unsafe. I had free wifi, although I had to move to the outside porch for good reception. The pool however was totally unusable, as it was one big slimy pool of algae. Also their website mentions free airport pickup, but there was no such thing. Some of my friends also booked in this hostel, and they were very unhappy, as they also prebooked private rooms, but ended up in a dorm anyway, which was very dirty with lousy beds. There was no restaurant inhouse when I was there, but there is a very nice coffeehouse across the street that has everything from coffee to homemade lemonade and great subs (as well as airconditioning and free wifi). The location is actually pretty good, I was a bit afraid arriving on my own in the dark, but the next morning I discovered the neighbourhood is actually quite nice(although there sure is some dilapidation going around), with a lot of characeristic Garden District houses and quirky shops. You are also close to Charles Street with it's historic street car. Both this and the Magazine street bus take you to the French quarter easily. All in all not as bad as I feared when I read the reviews, but I am not planning on going back any time soon. After the Jazz fest I stayed at a French quarter hotel which was hardly more expensive but a lot cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs & dirty”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Griff
Reviews.Content: I was eaten alive by bed bugs on the first night we stayed there, completely covered in bites on both arms and torso. The owner tried to blame me saying I had brought them into the property which was complete nonsense. Harrison on front desk was very helpful though and arranged a new room & helped organise a free nights accomodation. That said I really cant recommend this place to anyone. It is falling to pieces & the owner needs to spend some money on it. I heard so many people complaining to the poor staff on front desk (e.g. broken showers, no water, ceiling falling down in one room etc). The Garden District is a lovely area but try and find another hotel in it. Avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “Should be closed by health department”
Reviews.Author: headed_home
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE UNLESS YOUR ONLY OTHER OPTION IS A BOX UNDER A BRIDGE. Do not trust the photos on the web, although the building is genuinely pretty on the outside. This place is a dump. This hotel is beyond filthy to say the least. We drove in at midnight, to a lobby filled with apparent prostitutes and junkies, too tired to look for another hotel. We arrived at our room via an ancient elevator steeped in a combination of dirty hair and Indian food smells, to find a severely unflushed toilet, a large and diverse collection of hair all over the bathroom, dirty unmatched sheets on aged army surplus mattresses, and dust at depths we didn't know was possible to achieve. The cab driver who took us to another hotel the next day said we'd be surprised to hear how many horrified people he picks up there to take elsewhere. We are not prissy--we love camping, etc. but do yourself a favor and find another reasonably priced place to stay--this place is just absolutely nasty.

Reviews.Title: “A horrid experience all around. Avoid this hell hole like the plague!”
Reviews.Author: Neuroslicer
Reviews.Content: A group of 7 of us from Memphis stayed at St. Vincent's this weekend while attending a local scooter rally. St. Vincent's ad states: "Our friendly staff will go the extra mile to ensure that your stay is comfortable and enjoyable." They also claim to have cable TV and phone in all the hotel rooms. Nothing could be further from the truth. Upon arrival, we were all shocked at the state of disrepair of the house. Walls were dirty with cracked paint, furniture in the halls and on the porches was broken, the pool looked like a cesspool. We checked into our room and found no TV, no phone, torn curtains, a broken fridge, no clock, not even a garbage can. The mattresses looked at felt at least 40 years old! There were no towels, but we figured that getting towels would at least be a fairly simple task. We went to the front desk and Eric told us that there were no towels to be had... they had all been locked up in the housekeeping closet, and that only housekeeping had keys to that closet. I was able to share a towel from a friend's room, but anticipated getting fresh towels the next day. Our bed sheets didn't look very clean (at best they were worn and old), but we figured we'd get clean sheets the next day after the maid serviced our room. Later the next day, when coming back to the hotel from a full day around NOLA, we found that our room had not been cleaned by housekeeping. We mentioned this to Eric, and he said we had an attitude that he did not appreciate. He said they do not make up the rooms on a daily basis, and this should have been explained to us upon check in.
